responses.content: We delivered the best quarter in Salesforce history with our first $10B quarter, 8% revenue growth, and record cash generation. Data Cloud plus Agentforce has become a multibillion-dollar AI product line, including 3,000 paid deals in 90 days, 380,000 Agentforce conversations at 84% resolution, and 50 trillion records in Data Cloud. Customers are buying the trinity of apps, data, and agents together, which reinforces our #1 AI CRM positioning and differentiates us from the competition.

Agentforce is redefining how work gets done; the right mix of sales, service, marketing, analytics, Slack, and data cloud is what customers want. We are the only company delivering a unified platform that spans those layers, allowing every Trailblazer to become an Agentblazer. This moment is the digital labor revolution, and we are committed to helping customers orchestrate humans plus agents.

We thanked Brian and Amy for their decades of service and welcomed Robin Washington as our new COFO, the blend of COO and CFO that will guide Salesforce through this next era. The management team has been rebalanced with Miguel Milano running sales, Srini leading services and engineering, and David Schmaier as Chief Product & Impact Officer.

Agentforce and Data Cloud are turbocharging our multi-cloud deals; customers see the ROI from digital labor and are using the full Salesforce trinity. Channel diversification via AWS Marketplace and enhanced attrition management are also contributing to growth.

Agentforce is embedded across our own businessâ€”380,000 automated service requests, quoting 75% faster, and every one of our top deals includes AI, Data Cloud, and Slack. The productivity gains are enabling faster deal flow and improved sales coaching.

We finished FY25 with $37.9B revenue, 33% non-GAAP operating margin, $13.1B operating cash flow, and $12.4B free cash flow. Our FY26 guidance assumes $40.5-40.9B revenue, 34% non-GAAP margin, 10-11% operating cash flow growth, 2% CapEx, and 9-10% free cash flow growth while remaining committed to priced expansion and disciplined investments.

We're focused on profitable growth: invest in innovation (Agentforce/Data Cloud), optimize the go-to-market, and return cash ($7.8B repurchases + $1.5B dividends in FY25). Any M&A must be best-in-class and accretive; otherwise the priority is shareholder value via free cash flow per share.

We are evolving from seat-based models to consumption, similar to Data Cloud. Agentforce pricing is anchored around per conversation/credit models. We're already seeing customers blend human-based clouds with Agentforce, and universal credits will provide greater flexibility while monetizing the high-margin agent opportunity.

Joining Salesforce is exhilarating. The trinity of apps, data, and agents is delivering sustainable, profitable growth, and I'm honored to help guide the company through this next AI- and Agentforce-led era.

questions: You're seeing a halo effect across product lines from Agentforce. What are you seeing in terms of other clouds getting pulled into these engagements?

How do you think about the growth equation, multi-cloud international expansion, and how much of that is driven by AI vs. attributes such as pricing, packaging, and channel? Also, how does the pricing evolve as Agentforce brings productivity gains?
Q4 saw measured buying and a go-to-market realignment. Is the softness more economic or tied to the sales changes?
You described an initiative around a more unified core. What is being done, and how big is the prize from delivering a more tightly integrated platform?

With all the AI enthusiasm, is there a risk the SaaS model becomes a crowded database? How do you see the SaaS technology stack fitting into the agentic world, especially versus pure consumption plays?
Given the complexity and security concerns, how quickly can customers deploy Agentforce, and is Data Cloud required to drive meaningful value?
